gui

Class Reporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • gui.Reporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Reporter
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    Provides an alternative for the standard output. You could also use it to send System.out to a window by using: 
     System.out(reporter.getPrintStream());
    The user can copy & paste the contents for further use.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Reporter

        public Reporter(java.lang.String title)
        Constructs a small outputFrame of size(10, 30) and shows it. The frame is closeable();
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the window

      • Reporter

        public Reporter(java.lang.String title,
                int rows,
                int cols)
        Constructs an outputFrame of given size and shows it. The frame is closeable().
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the window
        rows - The number of text rows
        cols - The number of text columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - title String can not be null
        java.lang.AssertionError - title String can not be empty
        java.lang.AssertionError - rows must at least be one
        java.lang.AssertionError - cols must at least be one
